Musical fantasy, starring Meryl Streep, Johnny Depp, James Corden and Emily Blunt.(n)

programme.title: The Adventurer: The Curse of the Midas Box
programme.desc: A teenager searching for his missing family follows a trail of clues that lead him to a hotel on a remote island, and he becomes involved in a search for a magical box that could be a powerful weapon in the wrong hands. Period fantasy adventure based on GP Taylor's novel Mariah Mundi, starring Aneurin Barnard, Michael Sheen, Lena Headey and Sam Neill.(n)

programme.title: Surf's Up
programme.desc: A penguin longs to follow in the footsteps of his hero, legendary surfer Big Z, and leaves his Antarctic home to compete in a prestigious tournament on a tropical island. Unfortunately the waves in this warmer climate are much bigger than anything he has experienced - and the egotistical reigning champion does not take kindly to competition. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jeff Bridges and Shia LaBeouf.(n)

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka.(n)

programme.title: The Iron Giant
programme.desc: A huge robot falls from outer space and crash-lands in a small American town, terrifying the locals with its fearsome appearance. The kindly giant is befriended by a lonely youngster - but trouble looms on the horizon when a corrupt government agent sets his sights on destroying the visitor. Family animated adventure based on the children's story by poet Ted Hughes. With the voices of Vin Diesel, Eli Marienthal, Jennifer Aniston and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Robots
programme.desc: Rodney the robot heads for the city, hoping to find an investor for his latest invention. Instead, he winds up clashing with an evil business mogul intent on stopping a manufacturer from making spare parts needed for ageing robots - so Rodney teams up with assorted rusty rejects to put the matter right. Animated adventure, with the voices of Ewan McGregor, Halle Berry, Robin Williams, Greg Kinnear and Amanda Bynes.(n)

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner.(n)

programme.title: Surf's Up
programme.desc: A penguin longs to follow in the footsteps of his hero, legendary surfer Big Z, and leaves his Antarctic home to compete in a prestigious tournament on a tropical island. Unfortunately the waves in this warmer climate are much bigger than anything he has experienced - and the egotistical reigning champion does not take kindly to competition. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jeff Bridges and Shia LaBeouf.(n)

programme.title: The Magic Reindeer
programme.desc: A young reindeer frantically searches for his missing little brother. If he is to bring his sibling home safely in time for Christmas, he is going to need all the help he can get from his friends. Animated adventure sequel to The Flight Before Christmas, with the voices of Matthew Boyle, Darragh Kelly and Ned Dennehy.(n)

programme.title: The Iron Giant
programme.desc: A huge robot falls from outer space and crash-lands in a small American town, terrifying the locals with its fearsome appearance. The kindly giant is befriended by a lonely youngster - but trouble looms on the horizon when a corrupt government agent sets his sights on destroying the visitor. Family animated adventure based on the children's story by poet Ted Hughes. With the voices of Vin Diesel, Eli Marienthal, Jennifer Aniston and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Robots
programme.desc: Rodney the robot heads for the city, hoping to find an investor for his latest invention. Instead, he winds up clashing with an evil business mogul intent on stopping a manufacturer from making spare parts needed for ageing robots - so Rodney teams up with assorted rusty rejects to put the matter right. Animated adventure, with the voices of Ewan McGregor, Halle Berry, Robin Williams, Greg Kinnear and Amanda Bynes.(n)

programme.title: Ghosthunters: On Icy Trails
programme.desc: A fearful young boy forms an unlikely bond with a loveable green ghost and tries to help him reclaim his haunted house. Family adventure, starring Anke Engelke, Milo Parker and the voice of Bastian Pastewka.(n)

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: A child is taken in by kind-hearted Santa and raised as an elf - so it comes as a shock when he discovers years later that he is in fact human. Deciding to get back to his roots, he heads off for New York in search of his long-lost family, but is ill-prepared for the hustle and bustle of the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, starring Will Ferrell, James Caan, Zooey Deschanel and Edward Asner.(n)

programme.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
programme.desc: Comedy mixing live action and animation, set in a 1940s Hollywood where cartoon characters are real. A seedy private eye with a hatred of `toons' reluctantly ends up helping to clear an animated rabbit accused of murdering his wife's human lover. Starring Bob Hoskins, Christopher Lloyd, Joanna Cassidy and Stubby Kaye, with voices supplied by Mel Blanc, Kathleen Turner and Charles Fleischer.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: Bird on a Wire
programme.desc: A police informant responsible for the conviction of a drug dealer enters a witness protection scheme. Years later, his former college sweetheart recognises him at a petrol station, blowing his cover. They are forced to flee from both sides of the law when the dealer is released, bent on revenge. Comedy adventure, with Mel Gibson, Goldie Hawn, Bill Duke, Stephen Tobolowsky and David Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Assassin
programme.desc: A hitman is hired by two notorious gangster brothers to murder a politician. He falls for a woman during the assignment, but does not realise she is his victim's daughter. Her investigation of her father's death threatens to cause a gang war and puts the assassin at odds with his employers. Crime thriller, starring Danny Dyer, Gary and Martin Kemp.(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane.(n)

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Brown's novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno.(n)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: A veteran US submarine captain receives an incomplete message after a Russian base falls into rebel hands, and is convinced it is an order to fire his nuclear weapons. However, his first officer refuses to take such potentially devastating action without confirmed orders, leading to a deadly battle of wills. Thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington and Viggo Mortensen.(n)

programme.title: Chaos
programme.desc: A veteran cop and his inexperienced new partner are assigned to investigate a bank heist. At first sight, no money appears to have been stolen. However, it eventually emerges the criminal mastermind behind the robbery had a more complex and profitable scheme in mind - and a possible connection to the detective on his trail. Crime thriller, starring Jason Statham, Ryan Phillippe and Wesley Snipes.(n)

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Brown's novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno.(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton.(n)

programme.title: The Sea Inside
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a fisherman who is paralysed from the neck down in a diving accident. After spending years dependent on others to take care of him, he decides to fight for the legal right to end his own life. Starring Javier Bardem, Belen Rueda and Lola Duenas. In Spanish, Catalan and Galician.(n)

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the world's biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the world's first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac.(n)

programme.title: A Fistful of Dollars
programme.desc: A mysterious gunslinger rides into a town on the Mexican border divided by two warring families. After killing the henchmen of one clan, he seems to have made it clear where his loyalties lie and is hired by their rivals. However, he is secretly planning to play them off against each other to his own advantage. Sergio Leone's Western, with Clint Eastwood making his first appearance as The Man with No Name alongside Gian Maria Volonte and Marianne Koch.(n)

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.(n)

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: A series of devastating personal traumas leave a woman feeling self-destructive and lost. After spending years behaving recklessly, she decides to turn things around by embarking on an epic, solo trek along America's 1,000-mile-long Pacific Crest Trail, which gives her the time and space to reassess her existence. Drama based on a true story, starring Reese Witherspoon and Laura Dern.(n)

programme.title: Interstellar
programme.desc: In the future, Earth has been devastated by an environmental catastrophe and will soon become incapable of supporting human life. A former astronaut is recruited to carry out a desperate mission - piloting the last remaining spacecraft through a wormhole in search of another planet that can become humanity's new home. Sci-fi drama, starring Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway and Michael Caine.(n)

programme.title: Ex Machina
programme.desc: A computer programmer working for the world's biggest search engine is given the opportunity to spend a week at the remote home of his boss, a hi-tech genius. The break turns out to be an elaborate experiment, in which he must test the world's first truly artificial intelligence, which is housed in the body of a beautiful robot girl. Sci-fi drama, starring Domhnall Gleeson, Alicia Vikander and Oscar Isaac.(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A drug addled private detective unwittingly becomes embroiled in an elaborate kidnapping case in Los Angeles during the 1970s involving an old flame, her billionaire boyfriend and his wife. Comedy drama based on Thomas Pynchon's acclaimed novel, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin and Reese Witherspoon.(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: Kramer has sleeping problems thanks to a fast food outlet's bright neon sign, Elaine makes a huge mistake with the company credit card and George's ploy for a second date backfires. Meanwhile, Jerry gets an old friend into trouble. Comedy, with Michael Richards, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Jason Alexander and Jerry Seinfeld.(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: Newman wants to be transferred to Hawaii, so Jerry helps out. Elaine's blind date turns out to be terrible at ending relationships, and George's hopes of a new apartment are spoiled by a shipwreck survivor.(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: George dates a female prisoner, enjoying the freedom the relationship offers him. Jerry's reputation is on the line when his cheque bounces, Kramer gives his new pet a familiar name and Elaine realises her boyfriend is going bald. Comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Jerry Seinfeld, Michael Richards and Julia Louis-Dreyfus.(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld
programme.desc: Jerry buys back his parents' old car, and Kramer finds he cannot sleep with his girlfriend, while the Costanzas work out what to do with George's inheritance.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How Britain changed during the reign of the Tudor and Stuart monarchs. The programme explores the battles that established England as one of the world's leading naval powers and delves into Henry VIII's feud with the Catholic Church, revealing how he tried to silence dissenting voices. Contributors including Helen Mirren and Ben Kingsley also discover how literature from the period sowed the seeds of revolution, and learn why a riot organised from a prison cell laid the foundations for civil war.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: A competitive eater disappears after winning $5,000 in a contest. At first, the obvious culprit is one of his rivals - until the team discovers he threatened his brother with a knife just days before the competition. Meanwhile, Danny faces a crisis of conscience.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: An artist disappears after secretly photographing strangers during intense personal moments then later painting them. Discovering she had angry confrontations with at least two of these unwitting subjects, the team suspects she has fallen prey to one of them - but with a gallery full of potential culprits, finding the guilty party is not easy.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team searches for water plant foreman Jason Turner, whose life had been threatened by a disgruntled employee he had made redundant. However, further investigation reveals the missing man had also been attempting to reconcile with his ex-fiancee, suggesting a new explanation for his disappearance.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: Elena frantically searches for her missing daughter, who she believes has been abducted by an estranged boyfriend. Meanwhile, the squad questions a tourist who claims his wife has been kidnapped, but cannot verify his allegations - until a stark discovery at his home sheds light on the situation.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: An eminent senator disappears - placing the agents under intense scrutiny from the media and government when they try to locate her. Their worries are compounded when no ransom note arrives, leaving the unit considering other suspects, including political enemies and a stalker, but a suicide drives them in a new direction.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez are called in to investigate when a wanted hitman is shot while committing a burglary. Erin doubts herself when a 12-year-old case is reopened by a young attorney attempting to get justice for his mother. Crime drama, starring Donnie Wahlberg and Bridget Moynahan.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny and Baez are called in to investigate the murder of one of the poorer tenants of an upmarket building in which 20 per cent of the apartments are made affordable for those on low incomes. Elsewhere, Frank has a disagreement with a detective friend of Gormley. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A key witness in a murder trial drops out and Erin is given the task of bringing a Mob informant back to New York and keeping him safe, with help from Danny and Baez. Meanwhile, Frank enters into tense negotiations with Mayor Poole about benefits for his officers.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: An emotionally distraught man holds Baez at gunpoint in an interrogation room after she serves him with a restraining order, and Danny must negotiate for her release. Meanwhile, Frank is faced with a personal and moral dilemma when Garrett asks for help in dropping charges filed against his son. Starring Tom Selleck, Donnie Wahlberg, Bridget Moynahan, Will Estes and Len Cariou.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin worries she's in danger when an unknown assailant breaks into her apartment and also attacks on of her colleagues. Meanwhile, Jamie and Eddie discover a pipe bomb in an elderly woman's home, and Frank investigates a charity that is soliciting money for the NYPD. Crime drama, starring Bridget Moynahan and Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Eddie faces a new challenge when she goes on her first undercover operation, investigating a kidnapping ring targeting young women through fake youth hostel websites. Meanwhile, Frank helps an old friend who wants to visit a prison to confront the man who killed her family. Police drama, starring Vanessa Ray and Tom Selleck.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: A close-up view of sex, bug-style, as David Attenborough talks viewers through the different ways in which creepy-crawlies reproduce. Size matters for the minuscule male orb spider, creepily sneaking up on its intended and trying to mate without her noticing, while there's no rest for the lothario-like butterfly, which has plenty of notches on its proverbial bedpost. However, the harvestman spider has no use for sex at all, and reproduces by cloning itself.(n)

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough shifts the focus to bugs that prefer cooperation rather than conflict. They include burrowing cockroaches, the suitably named social spiders - which share a 30-metre web - the queen bee and her happy hive of workers, and green ants pulling together to build a nest.(n)

programme.title: The Affair
programme.desc: Cole and Luisa take a step forward in their relationship, as well as finding a new business partner, leaving Scotty out in the cold. Meanwhile, Alison makes a seismic decision. Dominic West and Ruth Wilson star.(n)

programme.title: The Affair
programme.desc: Alison is finally honest with Noah and herself, while a clash between Cole and Scotty is followed by tragedy. Dominic West and Ruth Wilson star. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Catelyn is forced to flee when the Baratheon brothers' rivalry comes to a bloody end, and Lord Baelish spots an opportunity to further his own ambitions. Tyrion discovers Joffrey is planning to use a secret weapon to defend his seat of power, and Theon sails for the Stony Shore to prove his worth as a Greyjoy. Arya receives a favour from the man she freed from Harrenhal, and the Night's Watch arrives at the Fist of the First Men to stem the advance of the wildling army.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu
programme.desc: Caine discovers a man hanging from a tree while walking in dense fog. Martial arts Western, starring David Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu
programme.sub-title: The Way of Violence Has no Mind.
programme.desc: Caine confronts a gang of Chinese immigrants who have turned to violence. Martial arts Western, starring David Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Gold of the Seven Saints
programme.desc: Two gold prospectors strike it rich, only to find themselves hounded by a motley crew of money-grubbing outlaws and greedy townsfolk eager to cash in on their good fortune. Western, starring Roger Moore, Clint Walker, Leticia Roman and Chill Wills.(n)

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A professional manhunter searches for three murderous train robbers who have taken cover in a backwoods town, but is unable to identify the killers among the community's residents. Meanwhile, the fugitives are aware of his arrival, and tensions begin to rise. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Dolores Dorn and Ernest Borgnine.(n)

programme.title: Wichita
programme.desc: Lawman Wyatt Earp takes a hard line to restore law and order to a frontier town overrun by outlaws, but faces a tricky task to flush all the bandits and desperados out of the area. Western, starring Joel McCrea, Vera Miles, Lloyd Bridges and Wallace Ford.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu
programme.desc: Caine recalls the lessons he learnt as a youth while he and a southern belle are trapped in a pit by kidnappers.(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu
programme.sub-title: Night of the Owls, Day of the Doves.
programme.desc: Caine tries his best to protect some prostitutes who want to start a new life.(n)

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: A thief's grieving widow persuades a gunslinger to help her find a cache of her husband's stolen gold and return it to the rightful owners. However, a group of Mexican bandits and a mysterious stranger are also after the loot. Western, starring John Wayne, Ann-Margret, Rod Taylor and Ben Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Return of the Gunfighter
programme.desc: An ageing gunslinger hopes to put his violent past behind him once and for all, but when he and his travelling companion meet a Mexican woman, they are persuaded to help her get revenge on the men who murdered her parents and stole their land. Western, starring Robert Taylor, Chad Everett and Ana Martin.(n)

programme.title: Darby's Rangers
programme.desc: A seasoned combat hero puts together and trains an elite team of American commandos for special action behind enemy lines in Italy and North Africa. Second World War adventure based on James J Altieri's autobiographical book The Spearheaders, starring James Garner, Etchika Choureau, Jack Warden and Edd Byrnes.(n)

programme.title: The Belly of the Beast
programme.desc: A former CIA agent's daughter is kidnapped by terrorists, prompting him to bypass diplomatic channels and strike out on his own to rescue her. Action thriller, starring Steven Seagal, Byron Mann, Monica Lo and Tom Wu.(n)

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt investigates a rape on the reservation which stirs up tension between the oil rig workers and the Cheyennes. Vic moves in with Cady after being evicted from her home.(n)

programme.title: The Cat Returns
programme.desc: A girl saves a cat's life, and is rewarded for her good deed by being whisked away to a magical land of powerful felines. Unfortunately, the King of the Cats soon sets his sights on her, and she must look to new friends to help her escape a horrible fate. Animated adventure, with the voices of Anne Hathaway, Cary Elwes, Peter Boyle and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Mr Popper's Penguins
programme.desc: A workaholic businessman always puts his job before his family until he receives an unexpected inheritance from his explorer father - six penguins. He abandons his plan to offload the birds to a zoo when he finds his kids love them, and sets about turning his New York apartment into a suitable habitat. Family comedy, starring Jim Carrey, Carla Gugino and Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Millions
programme.desc: A bag of stolen money falls from the sky, and wide-eyed youngster Damian thinks it is a gift from God. However, his level-headed brother realises they must race against time to spend the loot before the country switches to the Euro and a robber on their tail catches up with them. Comedy drama, starring Alex Etel, Lewis McGibbon, Daisy Donovan and James Nesbitt.(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Musical remake of the comedy about Tracy, an overweight teenager in 1960s Baltimore, who dreams of appearing on a TV dance show. However, a jealous rival and her scheming mother are determined to destroy her ambition - especially when Tracy tries to fight racism in the community. Starring Nikki Blonsky, Michelle Pfeiffer, Christopher Walken, James Marsden, Queen Latifah and John Travolta in drag as the heroine's mother.(n)

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: A writer interviews a man about the extraordinary events of his life. He describes his childhood in India, living in the zoo run by his father, and how the family and their animals were forced to relocate to Canada when he was a teenager. However, during the sea voyage, the ship sank and he was left adrift in a small boat with a ferocious tiger. Ang Lee's adventure based on Yann Martel's novel, starring Suraj Sharma and Irrfan Khan.(n)

programme.title: The Purge
programme.desc: Premiere. The American government responds to rising crime rates by introducing an annual 12-hour period when all laws are suspended, so the people can get violent impulses out of their system. A family takes shelter at home, but when a stranger turns up asking for help, the mayhem outside soon catches up with them. Horror, starring Lena Headey and Ethan Hawke.(n)

programme.title: In Fear
programme.desc: A couple go to Ireland for a music festival, but get hopelessly lost when driving through a series of country roads. Their plight turns deadly as they are terrorised by mysterious figures lurking in the darkness, while an encounter with a seemingly harmless local brings dangers of its own. Horror, starring Iain De Caestecker, Alice Englert and Allen Leech.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Agent Club
programme.desc: A youngster proves he's a chip off the old block by leading a group of friends on a daring mission to rescue his secret agent father from evil enemy spies holding him hostage. Comedy, starring Hulk Hogan, Lesley-Anne Down and Matthew McCurley.(n)

programme.title: Sony Movie News Extra
programme.desc: Update on the latest film news, rumours and celebrity gossip.(n)

programme.title: An Evergreen Christmas
programme.desc: A woman is forced to put her Hollywood music career on hold and return to her small Tennessee hometown to attend her father's unexpected funeral. As the eldest sibling, she finds herself executor of an estate that owes a massive inheritance tax, much to her younger brother's dismay. Drama, starring Charleene Closshey.(n)

programme.title: Santa with Muscles
programme.desc: A head injury leaves a cold-hearted millionaire with amnesia. He quickly becomes convinced he is really Santa Claus and sets out to save an orphanage from closure. Christmas comedy, starring Hulk Hogan and Don Stark.(n)

programme.title: To Catch a Yeti
programme.desc: An incompetent big-game hunter pursues the fabled Abominable Snowman, unaware the creature is really teddy-bear-sized. His quest leads him to America, where the tiny monster has befriended a little girl whose father inadvertently smuggled him into the country. Children's adventure, with Meat Loaf, Chantallese Kent, Jim Gordon, Richard Howland and Leigh Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Roxanne
programme.desc: A sensitive fireman believes he has no chance of ever winning the heart of a lovely astronomer owing to his large nose, and instead agrees to help a handsome colleague woo her, causing himself no end of heartache. Romantic comedy based on Cyrano de Bergerac, starring Steve Martin, Daryl Hannah, Rick Rossovich and Shelley Duvall.(n)

programme.title: Year One
programme.desc: An inept hunter and his shy gatherer sidekick are kicked out of their tribe and left to wander the Old Testament world. Blundering through several key moments of the Bible, they eventually end up at Sodom, where they must try and rescue their people from slavery. Comedy, starring Jack Black, Michael Cera, Oliver Platt and Hank Azaria.(n)

programme.title: Hope and Glory
programme.desc: London is in upheaval during the Blitz, but for a young boy the devastation presents a fabulous adventure. He is later sent to live with his grandfather, in whom he discovers a wonderfully eccentric and playful friend. Director John Boorman's Oscar-winning semi-autobiographical drama, starring Sebastian Rice-Edwards, Sarah Miles, Susan Wooldridge, Ian Bannen and Sammi Davis.(n)

programme.title: Swinging with the Finkels
programme.desc: Alvin and Ellie Finkel find the passion has gone out of their relationship, and hit upon the idea of indulging in partner-swapping with other couples. However, finding suitable candidates for their sexual adventures proves harder than expected. Comedy, starring Martin Freeman, Mandy Moore, Melissa George and Jonathan Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: David Suchet: In the Footsteps of St Paul
programme.desc: Two thousand years ago, St Paul helped transform the teachings of Jesus into a new global religion and the dominant force in Western civilisation. Not bad for a man who started out as an active persecutor of Christianity. Actor David Suchet begins the first of a two-part journey in search of this most enigmatic of figures, tracking Paul's early life and career, his conversion on the road to Damascus and the start of his missionary work, when he challenged the world of the classical gods and established the first churches.(n)

programme.title: Cue the Queen: Celebrating the Christmas Speech
programme.desc: The history of the monarch's annual televised address to the nation.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less at Christmas
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin don their Santa hats to help the Goff family save money and time this Christmas. This is the one time of year that people go all out, but is it possible to put on the perfect party without breaking the bank? Does it make a difference where the turkey comes from? And who makes the best mince pies? Gregg and Chris set out to answer these and other questions.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The show heads to Shropshire as Christina Trevanion and Kate Bliss each lead a team in the search for antiques in the historic market town of Oswestry, one of the UK's oldest border settlements. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Donkey's Caroling Christmas-tacular
programme.desc: Animated short following the efforts of lovable Shrek character Donkey, who tries to get his friends in a festive mood by singing a series of Christmas songs. Featuring the voices of Eddie Murphy, Mike Myers and Cameron Diaz.(n)

programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: The grumpy ogre longs for his simple life as a feared monster, so strikes a deal with magical trickster Rumpelstiltskin to get back to the way things were. However, he soon finds there is a catch - he ends up stuck in an alternate world where none of his friends know who he is and where Rumpelstiltskin has become the kingdom's tyrannical ruler. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy and Cameron Diaz.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress Cheryl Fergison, presenter Stacey Dooley, boxing promoter Kellie Maloney and Casualty star Jane Hazlegrove sit in the Mastermind chair and answer questions on Sir Elton John, the American TV series Girls, British Heavyweight Boxing, and Harper Lee.(n)

programme.title: A Question Of Sport Christmas Special
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in a festive edition of the quiz, with Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell heading celebrity guests Vernon Kay, Rachel Riley, Iwan Thomas and Amy Williams in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A vengeful Vincent comes up with a dangerous plan to get revenge on the Mitchells, and while those closest to him are worried about the consequences, can they stop him going through with it? Linda invites Shirley, Buster and Jade for Christmas dinner - although there might not be anything to eat if Mick cannot bring himself to kill the goose. Dennis is left upset when Bobby strikes again, so a fuming Sharon confronts Jane over his behaviour - prompting the stepmum to make a confession - and Martin encourages Shabnam to make up with Stacey, only for an unexpected incident to leave everyone stunned.(n)

programme.title: Snow Chick: A Penguin's Tale
programme.desc: Documentary following the first few months in the life of an emperor penguin born in an Antarctic midwinter. Kate Winslet narrates as cameras follow the young bird, watching him learn to survive the dangers of predators and the treacherous landscape of his home, before he is thrown into the ocean for the very first time.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Festive episode of the comedy following the ups and downs of three retired couples. The friends arrive at the Calais Shuttle terminal on their way home from the German Christmas markets, only for events to conspire to make their journey a little more fraught. Along the way, Carol gets an attack of claustrophobia, Trevor is caught trying to smuggle Rude Santas and John gets involved in a battle with a group of Germans over seating space. And all Joyce wants is to get home to be there for her granddaughter's first Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: It's John's grandmother's birthday, but he has completely forgotten to post her card. Will he be able to put things right on the journey to work? Comedy about the daily commute of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Danny Swarsbrick.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes faces her busiest yuletide ever, with Trevor visiting from the missions, grandson Bono sleeping over on Christmas Eve and three new mouths to feed now that Dermot is the proud father of triplets. If that wasn't enough to juggle, she decides to take on the task of staging a nativity play at the community centre. Meanwhile, Buster and Dermot compete to play Santa in the Grotto, while Dino waits to see whether Rory will take him to the hairdressing award ceremony. Brendan O'Carroll stars. Festive special from 2012.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Fockers
programme.desc: A hapless groom-to-be appears to have finally won the approval of his stern prospective in-laws, but faces a new challenge when he takes them on a vacation to Florida to meet his free-spirited sex therapist mother and eccentric house-husband father. The tension rapidly mounts as the mismatched families struggle to get along. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a two-bedroom house in Derbyshire, and revisit a stable in Kent, as well as a shop with a flat above in Wiltshire, then find out who bought them at auction.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed
programme.desc: The specialist police team searches for a stolen bag containing £100,000, while there is a rush-hour accident at Oxford Circus station. Plus, staff at the Thistle Hotel hunt for a Finnish flag before a delegation arrives from the country, and a team of singers, musicians, dancers and hidden cameras helps a man with a surprise proposal for his girlfriend. Narrated by David Reed.(n)

programme.title: James Martin - Home Comforts at Christmas
programme.desc: The chef demonstrates festive recipes and is joined by food historians and celebrity guests.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas Hamilton and the elephant rescue team race to save the life of a recently orphaned calf. The baby elephant is flown to an elephant orphanage in Nairobi, but with a terror threat on the Kenya's East coast, the family's safari camp is also in crisis. Saba must work to save the business and do all she can to protect Samburu's trusting elephants.(n)

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen continue their culinary journey in Salisbury, where they taste lardy cakes in the historic market place and eat venison stew in a coaching inn with a very dubious past. They also visit the home of watercress, enjoy a curry cooked on a fire where the locals' earliest ancestors lived and meet a 12ft giant who has presided over the city since the 14th century.(n)

programme.title: Short Circuit
programme.desc: A military robot is struck by lightning and develops a mind of its own. The machine embarks on a series of comic misadventures, but the company that made him want him back. He realises his only hope is to convince the scientist who invented him that he really is alive. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Steve Guttenberg, Ally Sheedy and Fisher Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Equestrian: Olympia 2015 Highlights
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie presents action from the prestigious event, which was staged over seven days at the Olympia Grand Hall in London, and featured the latest round of the FEI World Cup.(n)

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: Judges Kate Malone and Keith Brymer Jones ask the remaining potters to make 10 identical long necked vases using the Raku technique. This Japanese method of decorating and firing dates back to the 16th century and requires the contestants to take their red hot vases straight out of the kiln and plunge them into a bin full of combustible materials. Sara Cox hosts.(n)

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads
programme.desc: Bob and Thelma are determined to enjoy their festive celebrations to the full, but Terry quickly puts paid to their plans by offering to give them a lift to a party after passing his driving test. A Christmas episode of the comedy from 1974, starring James Bolam and Rodney Bewes.(n)

programme.title: The Polar Bear Family and Me
programme.desc: When Gordon Buchanan and the team return to Svalbard in September, they face a big challenge to find mother and cub as the tracking collar hasn't sent a signal for a month. They do eventually locate them and discover Lyra is very thin and has been reduced to eating moss, seaweed and even plastic fishing floats to stave off hunger. The bear's milk is also starting to run dry and she is refusing to let Miki suckle - while her desperation for food means that for the first time she sees Gordon as a possible meal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane follows the Welsh coast path around Anglesey, presenting tales of inspired thinking and coastal ingenuity. Tess Dunlop reveals how a small French fishing village gave rise to the birth of British commercial radio in the 1930s, Brendan Walker investigates why the 1970 collapse of Pembrokeshire's Cleddau Bridge changed the engineering world for ever, Dick Strawbridge is in Portsmouth, where he tells of a novel First World War plan to disguise British ships by hiding them in plain sight.(n)

programme.title: Perry and Croft: Made in Britain
programme.desc: The celebration of comedy writing duo David Croft and Jimmy Perry continues with an examination of how their sitcoms chronicled British people's attitudes to love and sex in the 20th century, looking at its depiction in Dad's Army, It Ain't Half Hot Mum, Hi-de-Hi! and You Rang, M'Lord?.(n)

programme.title: Alaska - Earth's Frozen Kingdom
programme.desc: To survive the bone-chilling cold, deadly blizzards and darkness of the eight months of an Alaskan winter takes courage, cunning and remarkable endurance. This episode tells the stories of how the tough and resourceful animal and human inhabitants of the windswept mountain peaks, icy tundra and snowbound forests face up to the challenges of the season. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore hopes to turn some old manhole covers, two forlorn seats and an antique suit stand into hard cash after rescuing them from a Surrey tip.(n)

programme.title: Back in Time for Christmas
programme.desc: Part two of two. During their trip from the 1970s to the 1990s, the Robshaws discover how the race for a Christmas number one single was born. They also meet an EastEnders star who reminisces about the soap's tradition of festive misery, and examine Christmas gluttony in the 1990s.(n)

programme.title: Gorilla Family and Me
programme.desc: Part one of two. Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan travels to the Democratic Republic of the Congo, where he realises a lifelong dream by spending time with Grauer's gorillas, the largest primates on earth. He meets the fearsome alpha male Chimanuka and two babies, one a lonely orphan and as Gordon gains the trust of these mysterious, seldom seen animals, he discovers their incredible compassion and gets caught up in a battle between giant rival silverbacks for control of the family.(n)

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.desc: Teams made up of graduates from Christ's College, Cambridge and the University of Essex compete in the fourth match of the festive edition of the quiz. Among those facing questions from host Jeremy Paxman are broadcaster Natalie Haynes and news correspondent James Reynolds for Cambridge, and Antiques Roadshow expert Rupert Maas and Radio 5 Live broadcaster Dotun Adebayo for Essex.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The four finalists have one hour and fifteen minutes to create a dish without meat, fish or poultry in the invention test set by Marcus Wareing, Monica Galetti and Gregg Wallace. After tasting their dishes, the judges whittle their number down to three. The remaining chefs are then sent to Italy, where they cook under Enrico Crippa at the three Michelin-starred Piazzo Duomo, before preparing a six-course tasting menu for specially invited guests and the judges.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Shopping Fever 2015: John Lewis and the Retail Race
programme.desc: Presenter Cherry Healey goes behind the scenes of one of the nation's biggest stores, from the shop floor to the head office, to find out how it deals with the pressure of Christmas. For John Lewis, the festive season has become a year-long, full-scale military campaign, from the midsummer Christmas press launch, to the refining of the TV advertisement, to the discounting frenzy of Black Friday. Cherry sees the team tackle the challenges presented by ever-changing shopping habits, and uncovers how the retail giant contends with its online rivals.(n)

programme.title: Goodness Gracious Me Special
programme.desc: After their successful reunion in 2014 to help celebrate the 50th anniversary of BBC Two, the cast of the ground-breaking British Asian sketch show get back together for another one-off show. Featuring all-new sketches, including twists on old favourites such as the origins of the Kapoors and the Competitive Goddesses, as well as a visit to the trenches of the First World War with Captain Brownadder and a look at the original plans for the Taj Mahal. Starring Meera Syal, Sanjeev Bhaskar, Nina Wadia and Kulvinder Ghir, with an appearance by Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2: Christmas 2015
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe gets the festive season under way with a selection of Christmas-themed hits from the show's archive, including performances by Tom Jones and Adele, and yuletide favourites by Wizzard, Slade, Jona Lewie, the Pogues and Kirsty MacColl and Shakin' Stevens. Also featured is a recording of Pulp dressed up in winter attire for a rendition of their classic Britpop hit Common People, and a spot of traditional crooning courtesy of Cilla Black.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Swing pop group Jack Pack talk about their plans for Christmas and perform a classic rendition of Santa Claus Is Coming to Town. Plus, a lively mix of news and current affairs, as well as health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Sean Fletcher and Charlotte Hawkins.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly talks to Downton Abbey star Ed Spellers about his role in the new series of Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands. Plus, actress and singer Jodie Prenger discusses the UK tour of Tell Me on a Sunday.(n)

programme.title: Rebound
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hosts the quickfire quiz that tests the general knowledge of six contestants, who go head to head in a bid to walk away with a big cash prize. The players must give as many correct answers as they can in the time it takes the 'Rebound Bar' to move across the studio, with the money on offer rising accordingly.(n)

programme.title: Pick Me
programme.desc: Lively, loud and energetic audience members compete for the attentions of host Stephen Mulhern. If he selects them to play they could win cash, or a major prize - but only if they come out on top in a dramatic, often hilarious game of knowledge, judgement and bluff.(n)

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a revival of the popular game show. Asking players to `see it and say it', he challenges them to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues, and one contestant will go through to the Super Catchphrase round for the chance to win £50,000.(n)

programme.title: Bean
programme.desc: The hapless fool is employed as a security guard for a British art gallery and is sent to Los Angeles to bring back a famous painting. Unfortunately, he finds himself mistaken for a renowned art professor and invited to make an important presentation. Mel Smith's British comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Burt Reynolds, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Peter Capaldi and June Brown.(n)

programme.title: The Sound of Music Live
programme.desc: Popular musical The Sound of Music is brought to life on soundstages at London's Three Mills Studio, in a live TV dramatisation of the timeless story of Maria and the von Trapp family. Based on the original, the drama will include classic songs such as How Do You Solve a Problem Like Maria, Edelweiss, Do-Re-Mi, My Favourite Things, Climb Ev'ry Mountain, and the title song. Starring Kara Tointon, Julian Ovenden, Katherine Kelly and Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The Chase for Text Santa
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts a special edition, inviting celebrities Robert Rinder, Andrea McLean, Brian McFadden and Denise Robertson to take on a Chaser in order to win thousands of pounds for the TV appeal.(n)

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas returns home, but is shocked to learn about Diane's plans to sell her share of the pub and that she has met her ex Gordon through attending chemo. Aaron is persuaded to help Ross with a robbery, and David discovers his money has been taken, but there's no sign of the ring. Bernice finds out what Lachlan and Gabby have been up to, and Zak comes to Joanie's rescue.(n)

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David bumps into Marion after she has had her purse stolen, so he offers to bring Max round to lift her spirits. Meanwhile, Todd is stunned when he answers Tracy's phone, and discovers the caller is Rob. When Sally tells Anna that she wants some time alone with Tim this Christmas, Anna wonders how she's going to explain that to Faye, and convinced Hope will be home for the big day, Tyrone wants the Lapland project to be better than ever.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Robert has no wish to find the monster that is killing wealthy young men, but the trail is too compelling to resist. It leads him to a fight with a beautiful vampire who shocks him with the news that she's his sister, Olalla. She also tells him Dance is alive and being rebuilt by eel creatures. Robert is suspicious of a trap and sets a test - if she can turn into a Jekyll he'll believe her. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Bateman and Wallis Day.(n)

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: As Murdoch continues with the search for his daughter, he is forced into one last extraordinary mission before Lucy can be freed. But, as a wanted man, it is a near-impossible task, and he must fight to get her to safety before the relentless Reinhardt catches her prey. Concluding instalment of the thriller, following the story of a prison officer who is forced on the run with a young female prisoner when his daughter is kidnapped. Starring Philip Glenister, Rosie Cavaliero, MyAnna Buring and Nathan Stewart-Jarrett. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Diary
programme.desc: A single woman begins a new year with resolutions to find love, quit her bad habits and take a step up the career ladder. Her plans crumble as she tries to deal with her mother's infidelity, get over a passionate fling with her boss and come to terms with her feelings for an uptight lawyer. Romantic comedy based on Helen Fielding's novel, starring Renee Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Colin Firth.(n)

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice.(n)

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Swing pop group Jack Pack talk about their plans for Christmas and perform a classic rendition of Santa Claus Is Coming to Town. Plus, a lively mix of news and current affairs, as well as health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Susanna Reid, Piers Morgan, Sean Fletcher and Charlotte Hawkins.(n)

programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly talks to Downton Abbey star Ed Spellers about his role in the new series of Beowulf: Return to the Shieldlands. Plus, actress and singer Jodie Prenger discusses the UK tour of Tell Me on a Sunday.(n)
