programme.title: Football's Greatest: Lionel Messi
programme.desc: A profile of the Barcelona star, who is widely regarded as being one of the world's finest ever players.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle investigate the murder of a prostitute, but their only clues are a pornographic film and a Eastern bloc-backed plot to blackmail a prominent politician tipped to become a future prime minister. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur spots a potential darts champion and enters him in a contest, where he duly gets nobbled. Undeterred, the dodgy dealer comes up with the idea of staging his own darts tournament. However, fewer players than expected enter, and Arthur is left scrambling to raise the prize money. Comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman.(n)

programme.title: Alias Smith and Jones
programme.desc: A former slave who is now a bounty hunter captures the infamous duo with the intention of claiming the reward. Drama, starring Ben Murphy and Pete Duel.(n)

programme.title: British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Louise Goodman is joined by Gordon Shedden to look back at the 2015 season, which featured 10 meetings, starting and ending at Brands Hatch, with the likes of Shedden and Jason Plato challenging for the title.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 uncovers a plan to hold the home secretary hostage in order to demand the release of a dangerous prisoner. Cowley takes the politician's place at an award ceremony, hoping that with Bodie as his bodyguard, he can draw the enemy into the open and thwart the attempt. Drama, starring Martin Shaw, Gordon Jackson and Lewis Collins, and featuring Pamela Stephenson in an early role.(n)

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry's girlfriend Debbie starts work as a mobile hairdresser. Unfortunately the first house she attends is robbed, and she and Terry become suspects. When Arthur becomes involved, the police take over his lock-up. Vintage comedy drama, starring Dennis Waterman and George Cole.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop staff examine a 1960s Cadillac, a collection of baseball world series rings and two antique pistol lighters.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine some of renowned lawman Wyatt Earp's belongings and an Olympic medal, while Rick is suspicious of some 19th-century guns in perfect condition.(n)

programme.title: The Rawhide Years
programme.desc: A riverboat gambler hoping to settle down with the love of his life is instead forced to go on the run after being falsely accused of murder. Three years later, he returns to track her down and prove his innocence. Western, with Tony Curtis, Colleen Miller and Arthur Kennedy. Including FYI Daily.(n)

programme.title: Death of a Gunfighter
programme.desc: A frontier marshal kills a drunken man in self defence, but finds his uncompromising brand of justice is no longer condoned by the locals. When he refuses to step down, the town fathers realise they may have to use violent methods of their own to rid themselves of him. Western, starring Richard Widmark, Lena Horne, Carroll O'Connor and David Opatoshu. Including FYI Daily.(n)

programme.title: British Superbike Championship
programme.desc: James Whitham presents a look back at 2015, which featured nine meetings in the regular season, followed by three meetings at the end of the campaign known as `The Showdown'. England's James Ellison and Shane Byrne were among those competing for the title, alongside Australia's Josh Brookes.(n)

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith takes part in an unusual challenge at the Ascari Circuit in Spain, and the team puts the Ferrari 458 Speciale and the Porsche 911 GT3 to the test.(n)

programme.title: Jackie Chan's First Strike
programme.desc: A Hong Kong cop delves into the murky world of international arms theft to track down a missing nuclear warhead - but the bad guys try to get him out of the way by framing him for murder. Martial arts adventure, starring Jackie Chan, Jackson Lou, Annie Wu, Bill Tung and Jouri Petrov. In Mandarin, Cantonese, English, Russian and Ukrainian. Including FYI Daily.(n)

programme.title: Rumble in the Bronx
programme.desc: A Hong Kong cop visits New York to attend the wedding of his uncle, who has just sold his market store to an entrepreneur. The policeman volunteers to stick around to help get the business running, but they soon fall foul of a local biker gang. Martial arts adventure, starring Jackie Chan, Anita Mui, Francoise Yip and Bill Tung. In Cantonese and English. Including FYI Daily.(n)

programme.title: TT 2015
programme.desc: Craig Doyle, Steve Parrish and James Whitham take a look at the riders who have completed the circuit at an average speed above 130mph, including New Zealand rider Bruce Anstey, who accomplished the feat in 2014.(n)

programme.title: The Encore Hour
programme.desc: A look at some of the drama programmes coming up on the channel this month.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Sir Richard proposes to Virginia Hamilton as the war draws to a close, but James reacts angrily to the news. Meanwhile, Hazel falls seriously ill. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Stranger at the Gates - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mariette and Charley locate Pieter and beg him to stay, while Pop faces hostility from the villagers. Primrose does her best to make an impression on the Reverend Candy. David Jason and Pam Ferris star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A relative brings important news, and Nick is puzzled when Kate seems less than pleased to see her. Meanwhile, a wedding is thrown into confusion by a family death. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Andrew secures a patient's life-saving operation, but Kirsty is still left wondering if she's doing the right thing. Medical drama about a rural Derbyshire practice.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The establishment closes ranks to prevent Kavanagh overturning a murder conviction, and the ensuing wall of silence reminds him, not for the first time, that law and justice are not necessarily the same thing. Legal drama, starring John Thaw.(n)

programme.title: Life Begins
programme.desc: Becca catches Maggie reading her diary, driving a further wedge between them. Genevieve is named regional salesperson of the month at the travel agency, while Paul is criticised by an interfering parent governor who feels events at home are impairing his ability to teach effectively. Caroline Quentin and Danny Webb star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Kate seeks Nick's advice about one of her patients, who seems to be receiving threats, and Greengrass tries to take the law into his own hands. Dora Bryan guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Richard and Virginia honeymoon in Paris, but on their return are forced to reconsider their hopes of moving into a smaller home. Meanwhile, Eddie and Daisy return to Eaton Place to discover how much life at the house has changed.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: A Season of Heavenly Gifts - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pop befriends a pilot he rescues from his crashed plane, but suspects he is being drawn into a smuggling racket when the family is invited to a celebratory champagne night on the town. Drama, starring David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: A trap is set, but it remains to be seen whether it will have the desired result. Paul steps in to help a figure in distress, and in a turn of events she could never have foreseen, Ellie finds herself exposed and alone. David Tennant and Olivia Colman star in the penultimate episode of the mystery drama's second series, with Arthur Darvill, Jodie Whittaker, Andrew Buchan and Charlotte Rampling.(n)

programme.title: My Boy Jack
programme.desc: Harry Potter actor Daniel Radcliffe stars in his first TV drama as Jack, the son of poet Rudyard Kipling who signed up for battle in the trenches of the First World War and never returned home. His parents, played by David Haig - who has adapted his own play - and Kim Cattrall (Sex and The City) searched for years to find out what became of their boy and in so doing changed attitudes to war.(n)

programme.title: Date My Ex: Jo & Slade
programme.sub-title: I Have to Follow My Heart.
programme.desc: Jo's search for love comes to an end at the Ivy Hotel in San Diego, where she is joined by the remaining two contestants, and has to choose her new partner.(n)

programme.title: Be Beautiful
programme.desc: Beauty blogger Tia Ward demonstrates three great looks for lips.(n)

programme.title: When Do You Get Off
programme.desc: Dating show which sees one hopeful singleton try to break the ice with four potential sweethearts by spending the day with them at their place of work. At the end of the shift, the person looking for love has to decide which of the quartet of suitors they prefer. The first edition features 26-year-old motor service advisor Katie from Warrington, who will pick a date with either digger salesman Nick, aquarist Tom, supermarket produce manager Dean, or landscape gardener Ben.(n)

programme.title: When Do You Get Off
programme.desc: Thirty-year-old advertising sales advisor Dean from London tries to break the ice with four single ladies by spending the day with them at their place of work. At the end of the shift, he will decide who he would like to meet again out of motor parts sales manager Abby, wedding stylist Adele, weight loss therapist Lucy, and manufacturing engineer Yasmine.(n)

programme.title: Ladies of London
programme.desc: The reality series following a group of London socialites returns. After a horrible accident, Annabelle is back on the scene, Julie struggles with being a working mother, and Marissa plans a Thanksgiving dinner. Meanwhile, as the holiday approaches, Juliet and Caroline forge an alliance, however it could spell the end of Juliet's friendship with Marissa.(n)

programme.title: Ladies of London
programme.desc: The new Caroline on the scene hosts a holiday party, while Annabelle helps Julie to build her confidence. Plus, Caroline Stanbury runs into difficulties while running her own business.(n)

programme.title: Ladies of London
programme.desc: Caroline advises an ungrateful Julie on her new business, and the ladies celebrate New Year's Eve in the penthouse of an exclusive London hotel.(n)

programme.title: Ladies of London
programme.desc: The women deal with the fallout from Caroline Stanbury's New Year's Eve shenanigans, while Marissa gets good reviews for her Top Dog restaurant. Elsewhere, Caroline Fleming visits her grandmother in Denmark and Caroline Stanbury fights for her library.(n)

programme.title: Ladies of London
programme.desc: Julie extends an olive branch to Caroline Stanbury in spite of their fallout on New Year's Eve, and Marissa seeks Annabelle's advice ahead of the launch of her new restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Be Beautiful
programme.desc: Beauty blogger Tia Ward demonstrates three great looks for lips.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Miami
programme.desc: The start of the third season sees alliances between Miami's hottest housewives have changed, friendships have been shattered and Alexia Echevarria has returned.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Miami
programme.desc: Adriana and Lea's feud comes to a head when the two finally meet in a stormy showdown. Lisa questions her decision to buy her supposed dream home.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Miami
programme.desc: Adriana and Lea continue to fight, leaving their relationship in ruins and dividing the group in two, while Alexia reveals a shocking secret.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Miami
programme.desc: Romain surprises Joanna with a new house and agrees to attend sex therapy, but things take a turn for the worse. Later, sparks fly at Alexia's magazine cover party.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Jess from Beckenham picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the menus they have come up with. After having dinner with each of them, she decides who he wants to see again.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Amy from London is given five menus constructed by a quintet of potential sweethearts, and must decide which three she would like to meet based on the meals they planned.(n)

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: David from London picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the menus they have created. Having dined with the three women, he decides who he wants to see again. Narrated by Charlotte Hudson.(n)

programme.title: The Millionaire Matchmaker
programme.desc: Patti Stanger helps a pair of best friends find love, but first she needs to fix a dodgy haircut and convince one of them that not all women are gold-diggers.(n)

programme.title: Mob Wives
programme.desc: Karen throws a `pre-nup' party to educate the women about protecting their assets, Carla breaks disturbing news to Ang, and Drita hires staff for her store.(n)

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Melbourne
programme.desc: Janet has some tea products to show off, Gina launches her new shoe line and Jackie has a party launching her LaMascara High-Tea range.(n)

programme.title: Filthy Rich and Homeless
programme.desc: The five volunteers stay in several hostels across London and the intimidating experience forces each of them to react in different ways. Thomas befriends a recovering heroin addict, Ravi confronts personal demons while in the company of alcoholics and Clementine opts to have lunch with a friend rather than take part.(n)

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: A visit to the fortress's well-stocked treasure house, home to the Crown Jewels among other fabulous riches. The programme reveals the methods used to maintain the precious valuables and tells the story of the Cullinan Diamond - the largest the world has ever known - as well as the nefarious history of jewel-snatcher Colonel Thomas Blood.(n)

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: Shirley and Desmond have different ideas about moving.(n)

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.(n)

programme.title: Who Done It
programme.desc: An ice-rink sweeper ditches his career to become a private eye, but soon gets embroiled in a devious plot to assassinate a group of eminent British scientists. Comedy, starring Benny Hill, Belinda Lee, David Kossoff and Gary Marsh.(n)

programme.desc: The actress discusses her upcoming movie projects.(n)

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan.(n)

programme.title: The Divided Heart
programme.desc: Foster parents bring up a boy believed to be an orphan - until his real mother is traced as an Auschwitz survivor who wants him back. Drama set in post-Second World War Europe, starring Cornell Borchers, Yvonne Mitchell, Armin Dahlen and Alexander Knox.(n)

programme.title: Movie Talk Shorts: Helena Bonham-Carter
programme.desc: The actress discusses her upcoming movie projects.(n)

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.(n)

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News headlines, travel, weather and debate from across the capital.(n)

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: Shirley and Desmond think it's about time Michael appreciated his roots.(n)

programme.title: Desmond's
programme.desc: Sean and Desmond are duped into cooking for the Sunday School outing.(n)

programme.title: PhoneShop
programme.desc: The staff grow tired of Super Sales Wednesday, otherwise known as Family Fun Day, and are further aggrieved when they hear of the potential arrival of a security guard. Comedy, starring Tom Bennett and Martin Trenaman.(n)

programme.title: PhoneShop
programme.desc: The staff members compete to secure the title of salesman of the month after years of Little Gary Patel monopolising the award. Janine, however, can only think about her new boyfriend Don. Comedy, starring Emma Fryer and Tom Bennett.(n)

programme.title: PhoneShop
programme.desc: Janine is put in charge when Lance goes on his second honeymoon, and tries to teach Christopher how to go the extra mile for his customers. Meanwhile, Ashley has a date with a soldier. Comedy, starring Martin Trenaman, Emma Fryer and Tom Bennett.(n)

programme.title: Payback Season
programme.desc: A Premiership footballer escaped from the gang culture on his council estate through sport, but when he runs into some old friends he is dragged back into their criminal lifestyle. As he deals with being blackmailed by drug dealers, he must also prevent his younger brother from pursuing a life of crime. Drama, starring Adam Deacon and Nichola Burley.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Mountain Gorilla
programme.desc: Patrick Stewart narrates this documentary, following the last remaining members of the species as they fight for survival on the slopes of central Africa. Dominant silverback Cantsbee protects those close to him as they make a perilous descent to feed on bamboo. On the other side of the Rwandan volcanos, a young female gorilla looks to her father for guidance after being deserted by her mother, and a teenage silverback tries to strike out on his own in Uganda.(n)

programme.title: Mountain Gorilla
programme.sub-title: Last Stand of the Silverback King.
programme.desc: Ageing silverback leader Titus faces his greatest challenge when he tries to care for a vulnerable orphan, while hot-headed youngster Marembo sets about making his presence felt in the mountains of Uganda. Narrated by Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Mountain Gorilla
programme.desc: Some of the most vulnerable members of the species struggle to survive, including two orphans whose mothers were killed and a young female who is finding it difficult to deal with unfamiliar emotions. The new `gorilla king' also has trouble keeping those in his care under control. Narrated by Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Monkeys Revealed
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin explores the world of primates, from strange lemurs and acrobatic monkeys to enigmatic apes. He uncovers the secrets of the primates' success - their survival tactics and physical adaptations - and how their lives mirror those of their human cousins. He begins by meeting an orang-utan that uses soap to improve its personal hygiene, baboons with a taste for flamingos, criminal-minded macaques and fluorescent mandrills that don warpaint before going into battle.(n)

programme.title: Monkeys Revealed
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin continues his exploration of the primate world, considering how the secret to their success is the ability to live in close-knit family and social groups. This is demonstrated by the emperor tamarin males conned into childcare in Peru and the South African vervet monkeys that have a sophisticated alarm system to protect them from predators. But living together often has its problems, like the Barbary macaques in Gibraltar who have their babies stolen by others out to impress their boss, the matriarchal ring-tailed lemur societies where females battle one another with their children in tow, and the hamadryas baboons of Ethiopia where the males rule with an iron fist.(n)

programme.title: Monkeys Revealed
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin concludes his exploration of the primate world, considering their capacity to use tools and solve problems, something he claims sets them apart from most other families on the planet. By way of demonstration, the presenter goes to orang-utan school in Sumatra, visits Thailand to see long-tailed macaques floss their teeth with human hair and use tools to open oysters on the beach, and reveals how Ugandan chimpanzees pass on cultures and customs down the generations. He also meets a resourceful bonobo in the States that can order its own picnic on the phone and build a fire, on which it then toasts marshmallows.(n)

programme.title: Wainwright Walks
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury climbs to the summit of Castle Crag in Britain's wettest vale, the Borrowdale Valley, Cumbria. Her aim is to discover why it was the only one of the 214 fells included in Alfred Wainwright's pictorial guides with a height of less than 1,000ft.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.(n)

programme.title: Hitler: The Rise of Evil
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama tracing the formative years of the Nazi dictator, following the progression of a developing mind that went on to captivate a nation desperate for a leader it could believe in. Motivated by a combination of misplaced anger and ego, Hitler ultimately brought Germany to a state of chaos it had never experienced before. Starring Robert Carlyle and Stockard Channing.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: David Suchet: In the Footsteps of St Paul
programme.desc: Two thousand years ago, St Paul helped transform the teachings of Jesus into a new global religion and the dominant force in Western civilisation. Not bad for a man who started out as an active persecutor of Christianity. Actor David Suchet begins the first of a two-part journey in search of this most enigmatic of figures, tracking Paul's early life and career, his conversion on the road to Damascus and the start of his missionary work, when he challenged the world of the classical gods and established the first churches.(n)

programme.title: Cue the Queen: Celebrating the Christmas Speech
programme.desc: The history of the monarch's annual televised address to the nation.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less at Christmas
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin don their Santa hats to help the Goff family save money and time this Christmas. This is the one time of year that people go all out, but is it possible to put on the perfect party without breaking the bank? Does it make a difference where the turkey comes from? And who makes the best mince pies? Gregg and Chris set out to answer these and other questions.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The show heads to Shropshire as Christina Trevanion and Kate Bliss each lead a team in the search for antiques in the historic market town of Oswestry, one of the UK's oldest border settlements. Presented by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: BBC Wales Today; Weather
programme.desc: News and weather from BBC Wales.(n)

programme.title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
programme.desc: The intrepid archaeologist sets out to find his estranged father, who has gone missing while searching for the Holy Grail. Once reunited, the duo team up to finish the task and locate the sacred relic before the Nazis get their hands on it. Action adventure sequel directed by Steven Spielberg, starring Harrison Ford, Sean Connery, Alison Doody, River Phoenix, Julian Glover and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Donkey's Caroling Christmas-tacular
programme.desc: Animated short following the efforts of lovable Shrek character Donkey, who tries to get his friends in a festive mood by singing a series of Christmas songs. Featuring the voices of Eddie Murphy, Mike Myers and Cameron Diaz.(n)

programme.title: Shrek Forever After
programme.desc: The grumpy ogre longs for his simple life as a feared monster, so strikes a deal with magical trickster Rumpelstiltskin to get back to the way things were. However, he soon finds there is a catch - he ends up stuck in an alternate world where none of his friends know who he is and where Rumpelstiltskin has become the kingdom's tyrannical ruler. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy and Cameron Diaz.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress Cheryl Fergison, presenter Stacey Dooley, boxing promoter Kellie Maloney and Casualty star Jane Hazlegrove sit in the Mastermind chair and answer questions on Sir Elton John, the American TV series Girls, British Heavyweight Boxing, and Harper Lee.(n)

programme.title: A Question Of Sport Christmas Special
programme.desc: Sue Barker asks the questions in a festive edition of the quiz, with Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell heading celebrity guests Vernon Kay, Rachel Riley, Iwan Thomas and Amy Williams in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A vengeful Vincent comes up with a dangerous plan to get revenge on the Mitchells, and while those closest to him are worried about the consequences, can they stop him going through with it? Linda invites Shirley, Buster and Jade for Christmas dinner - although there might not be anything to eat if Mick cannot bring himself to kill the goose. Dennis is left upset when Bobby strikes again, so a fuming Sharon confronts Jane over his behaviour - prompting the stepmum to make a confession - and Martin encourages Shabnam to make up with Stacey, only for an unexpected incident to leave everyone stunned.(n)

programme.title: Snow Chick: A Penguin's Tale
programme.desc: Documentary following the first few months in the life of an emperor penguin born in an Antarctic midwinter. Kate Winslet narrates as cameras follow the young bird, watching him learn to survive the dangers of predators and the treacherous landscape of his home, before he is thrown into the ocean for the very first time.(n)

programme.title: Hinterland
programme.desc: New series. DCI Mathias is under pressure when his wife turns up in Aberystwyth and he is under investigation by the IPCC after the death of Mari Davies. However, when a bus driver's body is found shot on an isolated mountainside, the investigation provides him with a welcome escape. The team have a suspect to question, but Mathias believes he is an unlikely killer and is fascinated by an ex-soldier's life-style choices. Return of the crime drama, starring Richard Harrington In this new series.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: Festive episode of the comedy following the ups and downs of three retired couples. The friends arrive at the Calais Shuttle terminal on their way home from the German Christmas markets, only for events to conspire to make their journey a little more fraught. Along the way, Carol gets an attack of claustrophobia, Trevor is caught trying to smuggle Rude Santas and John gets involved in a battle with a group of Germans over seating space. And all Joyce wants is to get home to be there for her granddaughter's first Christmas.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Car Share
programme.desc: It's John's grandmother's birthday, but he has completely forgotten to post her card. Will he be able to put things right on the journey to work? Comedy about the daily commute of supermarket employees John Redmond and Kayleigh Kitson, who have been thrown together in a company car share scheme, with each trip bringing fresh insight into their lives, as well as twists and turns in their unlikely relationship. Co-written by and starring Peter Kay and Sian Gibson, with Danny Swarsbrick.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when barrister Luke Watchman dies of cyanide poisoning during his annual holiday at an inn. Crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide, Kevin McNally and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. An unpopular colonel is found dead in the vicarage of St Mary Mead and investigations reveal no shortage of suspects - including the vicar and members of the victim's family. Christmas edition from 1986, starring Joan Hickson, Paul Eddington and James Hazeldine.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: In the London of 2010, a chance encounter brings Watson, fresh from military service in Afghanistan, into contact with Holmes, a loner and genius who earns his living as a private detective. The duo's first case together sees them investigating the fourth in a series of suicides, and it seems even Inspector Lestrade - the best Scotland Yard has to offer - cannot compete with the sleuth. Drama bringing Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes stories into the 21st century, with Benedict Cumberbatch in the title role and Martin Freeman as Dr John Watson. With Una Stubbs and Rupert Graves.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: An investigation gets under way when barrister Luke Watchman dies of cyanide poisoning during his annual holiday at an inn. Crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide, Kevin McNally and William Simons.(n)

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: After a man is found hanging in the conservatory following a poetry recital, the priest soon realises he could not have committed suicide, and the search for a murderer begins. Drama, starring Mark Williams.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A British cop is murdered on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, and the local commissioner declares another officer from the UK must be flown over to lead the investigation. Enter DI Richard Poole, a brilliant detective with a unique approach to cracking crime, and just the man to solve the mystery of his colleague's death. The only problem is, he is totally unsuited to a life of sun, sea and sand - and worse still, it seems his boss back home wants him to stay there. First episode of the drama, starring Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Lenora Crichlow, Don Warrington, Danny John-Jules and Sean Maguire.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: British DI Richard Poole is trying to get used to his new Caribbean surroundings when news comes through of another murder - a bride shot through the heart with a spear gun just hours after getting married. Teaming up with Camille, Richard quickly establishes no one entered or left the fifth floor of the hotel where she was celebrating, meaning one of the wedding guests must have been responsible. Mystery drama, starring Ben Miller and Sara Martins, with Frances Barber, Matt Di Angelo and Paterson Joseph.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock
programme.desc: In the London of 2010, a chance encounter brings Watson, fresh from military service in Afghanistan, into contact with Holmes, a loner and genius who earns his living as a private detective. The duo's first case together sees them investigating the fourth in a series of suicides, and it seems even Inspector Lestrade - the best Scotland Yard has to offer - cannot compete with the sleuth. With Una Stubbs and Rupert Graves.(n)

First episode of the drama, starring Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Lenora Crichlow, Don Warrington, Danny John-Jules and Sean Maguire.(n)

programme.title: The Mindy Project
programme.desc: As the festive season approaches, Mindy wonders whether Danny is about to propose to her. Julia Stiles and Rhea Perlman guest star.(n)

programme.title: Famous Fred
programme.desc: Animation featuring the voice of Lenny Henry as Fred, a seemingly ordinary family cat who transforms into a singing superstar at night. The feline phenomenon lives a rock 'n' roll lifestyle, sleeping all day and partying until the break of dawn, but the constant bingeing on milk and caviar finally takes its toll. With Tom Courtenay and David Robb.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper falls for the ghost of a recently murdered man who needs her help, while Phoebe works as a psychic to help others - and make a little money for Prue's birthday present into the bargain.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Prue dreams about a handsome admirer who turns out to be a Freddy Krueger-style killer able to enter his victims' minds and dispatch them in a variety of gruesome ways. Not to be left out in the romance stakes, Phoebe and Piper cast a spell to attract men - but it ends up too strong, and lands them with more suitors than any girl could reasonably want.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Lisa burns with jealousy when Theresa turns up in a sexy Christmas outfit and tries to convince Zack that he should be with someone else. Meanwhile, Lockie convinces Porsche to meet with the solicitor and find out what Derek has left her. Tony plants a seed when he tells John Paul that Ste still loves him, Celine sees Cameron's angry side, and Leela tries to make her new flat feel like home for Peri.(n)

programme.title: Ivor the Invisible
programme.desc: The heart-warming story of 10-year-old John, who wakes up one morning to find an invisible giant sitting on the end of his bed. His secret friend proves helpful, vacuuming the carpets and even doing the washing-up, but his mischievous streak soon grows out of control and the little boy is forced to ask him to leave. Touching children's animation from the pen of Raymond Briggs, with the voices of Jane Horrocks, Timothy Spall and Alison Steadman.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part two of two. Barney confides in Ted that he plans to propose to Patrice and swears him to secrecy, but Ted feels he should tell Robin what is happening, and asks her to be his date to the gala opening of the GNB building. Meanwhile, Marshall and Lily enjoy their first night away together since the birth of Marvin and intend to savour every moment, but end up feeling anxious about their son.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel invites a TV reporter to do a story on her and the family to help improve her public image. However, when the journalist discovers she has a male nanny working for her, she decides to change the focus of the piece. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.sub-title: Dancing with the Stars of Toledo.
programme.desc: Mel agrees to participate in a charity dance event to raise money for the children whom Lennox tutors. However, creative differences cause her and Joe to part ways, so Stephanie manages to persuade celebrity dancer Mark Ballas to be Mel's partner. Comedy, starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper and Phoebe do the catering at a high-society wedding, unaware the groom-to-be is being forced into marriage by his mother - who has made a pact with the powers of evil and wants him to father a demon child. Starring Shannen Doherty and Holly Marie Combs.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Phoebe and Piper vie for Leo's attention, and a troubled teenager befriends Phoebe in the hope of joining the Halliwells. Unfortunately, they do not realise she is under the control of a sorceress who wants her to steal their powers.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Lily and Marshall are disappointed to discover Ted is meeting his former college girlfriend, who they find pretentious, while Barney plays a prank on his friends, causing embarrassment for the gang. Guest starring Laura Prepon (That 70s Show), with Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Karen breaks up with Ted, who later discovers that Lily deliberately sabotaged their relationship by making it appear that he had been unfaithful - and has also interfered in his previous relationships. Meanwhile, Barney and Marshall discuss the merits of pyjamas. Guest starring Laura Prepon (That 70s Show).(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newhart) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel is excited about the prospect of spending Christmas with her sister Meredith, who is on a home visit from prison. However, the festivities turn frosty when Joe realises that he may have to share the holiday season with the woman responsible for wrecking his career. Guest starring Jaime Pressly (My Name Is Earl).(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: As Mel and Joe prepare for their first Christmas together as a couple, competition heats up over whose ornament should take the prestigious top spot on the tree. To champion the worthiness of the ornamental star that has been owned by the Burkes for generations, Mel tells an elaborate tale from way back in her family's history.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: Ben and Danny wear elf suits on their quest to find a particular Christmas gift for Emma, while Riley and Tucker help Bonnie plan a seasonal celebration. Comedy, starring Jean-Luc Bilodeau and Tahj Mowry.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: As Christmas approaches, Ben grows grumpier about the yuletide season and wishes it had never existed. However, when his wish comes true, he is unprepared for the consequences. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: After discovering the Goliath National Bank has changed its mind about building a new office, Marshall and Barney lie to Ted to spare his feelings as his company was due to design the premises - only for him to be sacked after cutbacks are made. Meanwhile, the friends try to prise information out of Robin when they learn she almost spent a night with a Canadian celebrity.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted writes a list of things the friends are too old to do, but Barney - freshly banned from playing laser tag - sets out to perform each activity to prove him wrong. Elsewhere, Marshall's tough streak emerges during a game of basketball, filling Lily with misgivings. American sitcom, starring Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan and Neil Patrick Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard becomes concerned that Sheldon will overreact when his friend learns the truth about a past indiscretion, while Penny confronts Raj's old flame Lucy about the way she ended their relationship. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is dismayed when the group spends the Thanksgiving holiday at Mrs Wolowitz's house, but hits it off with Bernadette's father. Meanwhile, Penny realises she must deal with a mistake from her past when she and Leonard have an argument. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: When Lockie hears about the explosion, he is suspicious of Cameron and threatens to go to the police. Elsewhere, the police search for Reenie, John Paul and Ste meet under the archway, and Porsche asks Lockie to come to The Dog car park if he wants to be with her. Meanwhile, Lisa is filled with guilt when Simone and Louis present her with Christmas gifts, and later, she reveals her secret to Zack.(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: Bella Swan's confused feelings for vampire Edward and werewolf Jacob threaten to ignite a conflict between the two supernatural races. Meanwhile, a series of murders heralds the return of an old enemy, who has raised an army to aid her quest for revenge. Third part of the romantic fantasy series, with Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner and Bryce Dallas Howard.(n)

programme.title: Supernatural
programme.desc: When Sam scans the internet for suspicious paranormal activity, he finds a video of Charlie Bradbury beating up a district attorney. Dean suspects she has returned from the land of Oz to hunt alone, and that her victim must have been a demon. However, the brothers are shocked to find out the real reason for her return. Fantasy drama, starring Jensen Ackles and Jared Padalecki, and guest starring Felicia Day.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard stake their most coveted comic books on a bet over the species of a cricket, while Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first night together. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons, Simon Helberg and Kaley Cuoco-Sweeting star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon succeeds in getting Penny to conform to his high standards, so Leonard adopts a similar strategy for his romantic gain. Meanwhile, Howard and Raj meet two women at a goth nightclub and things appear to go well - until they are taken to a tattoo parlour.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate an Iron Age hill fort in Cardiff that dominates a city housing estate, and explore whether the site could be the long-lost ancient capital of south Wales. With five acres of ground and half a mile of ramparts and ditches to examine, time is not on their side, but, helped by the local community, finds such as the remains of jewellery and drinking vessels help paint a vivid picture of domestic life around 800BC.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Family Christmas
programme.desc: Alternatives to traditional Christmas desserts are on the menu as the chef is joined by his mum Sally in the kitchen to make a chocolate mousse. Jamie also shares his recipe for a winter pudding bombe using panatone, ice-cream, crystalised fruit and sherry, uses leftover Christmas pudding to create a festive strudel, and prepares a clementine jelly with help from his nephews.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage Bites
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall uses beef, tomatoes and shallots to cook a stew.(n)

programme.title: A Challenge for Robin Hood
programme.desc: The legendary medieval outlaw is forced to battle his own cousin when the scheming villain seizes control of the hero's rightful inheritance - while the wily Sheriff of Nottingham waits to turn the family feud to his advantage. Action adventure, starring Barrie Ingham, James Hayter, Leon Greene and Gay Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas
programme.desc: Charity fundraiser Rachel Speight-McGregor kicks off a week of festive dinner parties in York. She hopes a full-on evening's entertainment, including carol singers on arrival, will impress her guests - baristar Harry Baines, pub landlady Estella Nicholson, administrative assistant Nicola Gregory and junior doctor Gyles Morrison - and see her on her way to securing the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas
programme.desc: Junior doctor Gyles Morrison serves a uniquely Caribbean take on a traditional Christmas dinner. Administrative assistant Nicola Gregory is captivated by his charm and keen to demonstrate her affection for the laid-back medic, but the other guests are less enamoured by their host as the dinner party challenge continues in York.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas
programme.desc: In the third edition from York, vegetarian host Nicola Gregory hopes to convert four carnivores with her completely meat-free festive menu. However, the discovery by junior doctor Gyles Morrison and pub landlady Estella Nicholson of deer heads mounted in Nicola's garage leads the guests to question her vegan credentials. Meanwhile, charity fundraiser Rachel Speight-McGregor is more interested in drinking shots of salad dressing, and barista Harry Baines is concerned about his gift of a furry festive jock strap.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas
programme.desc: Harry Baines hosts the fourth festive edition of the competition from York and tries to prove to his fellow diners that his youth does not affect the quality of his cooking. To impress his guests he makes fiery cheesy focaccia, duck in blankets and mince pies.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas
programme.desc: Pub landlady Estella Nicholson hosts the last Christmas dinner from York in her own premises, rustling up a menu including festive fishcakes, cheesy elf bakes, drunken lamb, veggie moussaka and sticky toffee pudding. Admin assistant Nicola Gregory is keen to make amends for offending another guest, and after an eventful week, the winner is decided.(n)

programme.title: Jimmy's Grow Your Own Christmas Dinner
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty goes behind the large operation to put food on every family's table at Christmas, as workers in UK pudding factories, sprout fields and turkey farms go into overdrive to meet supermarkets' demand. He compares this mass production to the days when everything was home-grown, making his own fizzy booze and cheese, growing purple carrots and heritage potatoes and rearing rare-breed birds. Finally, he tests which offers the best quality by asking his friend Jamie Oliver to cook two identical Christmas menus, one using purchased ingredients, the other utilising home-grown food.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps workaholics David and Karen who cannot decide whether to buy a place to escape to in Dorset or the alpine city of Graz in Austria. Jasmine reveals what their £130,000 budget will get them in both locations.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Sue and Dave Atkins from Norwich have spent their time travelling since finishing work, and have now decided the Tampa Bay area in Florida is the best place to escape the cold British weather. With a budget of just over £100,000, Sara Damergi shows them five ideal properties.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Cracking Christmas
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver whips up a selection of festive, easily prepared dishes in his own kitchen, showing viewers how to impress friends and family with a menu full of delicious treats. Recipes for some of the chef's personal favourites, including beef Wellington, roast goose with all the trimmings, cocktails, steamed goose buns, and chocolate and marmalade panettone bread-and-butter tart, are certain to help keen cooks raise their Christmas spread to the next level.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After 20 years of travelling, a couple decide to build a contemporary, sustainable family home in the remote Campsie Fells in Stirlingshire, Scotland. Theo and Elaine Leijser have given themselves six months to finish the project on a very tight budget and complications soon arise when they source materials from all over the world, including a Swedish timber frame and cedar wood from Canada. Kevin McCloud observes their progress.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Presenter Tim Shaw, master mechanic Fuzz Townshend and a team of experts head to Eastbourne in East Sussex to take on an iconic French front-wheel drive car. The vehicle in question is a 1954 Citroen Traction Avant belonging to former watchmaker and classic car lover Andrew. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown Christmas Special
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show's version of the words-and-numbers game, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Kathy Burke and David Baddiel for comic innuendos, unpredictable conundrums and plenty of laughs. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Joe Wilkinson `assists' maths whizz Rachel Riley at the board.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A retired dockworker who suffers from diabetes is brought in with severe stomach pain. The doctors believe part of his gut may have permanently stopped working, creating a life-threatening situation where dangerous surgery is the only option. Other patients include a man who has twisted his knee dancing in a club, and a cyclist brought in unconscious after falling off his bike.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fancy dress enthusiast Anna is first to host in Salisbury, and she sets out to impress with an unusual tea party. On night two, DJ Ross organises a pirate-themed evening which goes slightly awry, and Fiona prepares traditional Irish fare on the third night. Finally, Tim cooks a Mediterranean feast, which he hopes will be good enough to bag him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants in Nottinghamshire try to outdo each other by throwing the perfect dinner party in a bid to win a £1,000 prize. The hosts are U2 enthusiast Lynn Negus, DJ and photographer Dennis Nyama, primary school teacher Maria Beal, and former roadie Pete Chaffe.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Christmas with Bells On
programme.desc: Part two of two. Having taken care of the preparation in the first show, Jamie Oliver now brings everything together for the perfect Christmas Day feast, putting a new twist on Brussels sprouts, making tacos and other snacks, and even spicing up the wine. Finally, he demonstrates how to make the best of leftovers with his Boxing Day turkey chowder.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Homemade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp devises presents for her friends and family, focusing on alternatives to high-street shopping. She visits a woman in Devon and picks up the ingredients to create her own soap. Later she prepares chutney, and learns the art of teddy bear-making and how to stitch a stocking to hang above the fireplace.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go hunting for two family homes in the north of England. New parents Karen and Chris are keen to return to their roots in the villages around Darlington, Co Durham, with baby Amelia. Kris and Heather have put wedding and holiday plans on hold until they find a house, but they are having trouble deciding between the city, the country or the coast.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick in London, Charlie and Patrick go and look at a valuable antique grandfather clock and unravel the meaning of mysterious engravings on a 1920s silver tray.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman embarks on a property search on the Caribbean island of St Vincent, and finds that a budget of £200,000 and house-hunters with uncompromising tastes force her to take drastic action to locate a suitable home.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Best Ever Christmas
programme.desc: Two-part special brought to life with animation, in which Jamie Oliver presents his favourite festive recipes. In the first edition, the chef focuses on Christmas Day food, demonstrating how to prepare a traditional turkey dinner with roast potatoes, gravy and vegetables. He also offers tips on making desserts including chocolate truffles and mince pies, as well as mulled wine.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go hunting for two family homes in the north of England. New parents Karen and Chris are keen to return to their roots in the villages around Darlington, Co Durham, with baby Amelia. Kris and Heather have put wedding and holiday plans on hold until they find a house, but they are having trouble deciding between the city, the country or the coast.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hull is the setting as Sophie and Shaun serve up a selection of their restaurant favourites. On the second night, Vikki and Lee opt for a Yorkshire theme, while the final couple Carl and Sue aim to show the others how it is done.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me Christmas Special
programme.desc: Four familiar faces take turns as host to win cash for charity. First up is former Coronation Street actress Helen Flanagan, who's trying to impress her guests with a sparkly dining party. The second night sees children's TV presenter Kirsten O'Brien go back to her roots with a Scandinavian-style bash, but will the exotic fare be a smorgasbord too far for Helen? Comic Mark Dolan then takes everyone back to Victorian England with a Dickensian Christmas, serving up pea soup, a three-bird roast and plum duff. And Happy Mondays frontman Shaun Ryder rounds off the week with a `festive rave-up'.(n)

programme.title: How the Rich Live Longer
programme.desc: Dr Christian Jessen investigates what the super-rich are willing to spend their wealth on in an attempt to live longer and, in some cases, forever. With some people in the wealthiest areas of Britain living up to 18 years longer than those in the poorest, Dr Jessen examines whether money really does make a difference when it comes to health and longevity. A high-end health industry servicing the financial elite has grown parallel to the NHS and goes way beyond what some might think of as private healthcare.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The nation's favourite armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, including The Royal Variety Performance, the Turner Prize, Meet the Psychopaths, I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, The Secret Life of 6 Year Olds, Single White Female and the News. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively - sometimes emotional - discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: The Rich Kids of Instagram: Cutting Edge
programme.desc: Photo and video-sharing internet service Instagram has given the world's wealthiest people the chance to show off their jet-set lifestyles like never before, offering a rare glimpse into what it's like to be super rich. This programme delves into the lives of affluent youngsters who post pictures of luxuries that most can only dream of, including Dimash from Kazakhstan, who posts pictures posing in front of his Porsche and considers himself the ultimate role model, and Nathaniel in San Francisco, who waves large amounts of money about to rub followers up the wrong way.(n)

programme.title: Cash Cab: After Dark
programme.desc: Taxi passengers find themselves playing for a big cash prize as they answer as many questions as they can before reaching their destination.(n)

programme.title: Cash Cab: After Dark
programme.desc: Taxi passengers find themselves playing for a big cash prize as they answer as many questions as they can before reaching their destination.(n)

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team continues working on the bike before its auction to raise money for the Victory Junction Gang Camp.(n)

programme.title: Custom My Ride
programme.desc: West Coast Customs transforms a Range Rover into a concept car for a member of Dubai's royal family.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: The men who protect and maintain peace and order within the Amish community in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania, beginning with how they deliver justice against those who stand in their way.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: Boss man Lebanon Levi and his crew hunt down one of their own crew members who is wanted for arrest by the local law enforcement.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: Lebanon Levi and his crew run a secret barn fight, and Mafia soldier Jolin must do battle and win to bring in the money and maintain his respect.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: In an attempt to repay his debts to Ohio boss Merlin, John arranges an illegal buggy race in the heart of Levi's territory.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: Levi's crew splinters just as his war with Ohio boss Merlin escalates, and his men must decide whether to stand by him and fight.(n)

programme.title: Amish Mafia
programme.desc: The producers of the show interview former crew members, asking them questions about their lives and on the Amish community.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Shopping from Home
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of the armchair.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Susan suggests to Roger that he should try to make Abi jealous, but Ben is convinced the plan will end in tears. Everyone is surprised when he takes her advice and shows up with a beautiful girlfriend. Comedy, starring Zoe Wanamaker and Robert Lindsay.(n)

programme.title: The Doctors
programme.desc: Medical talk show featuring a panel of practising professionals.(n)

programme.title: Dr Phil
programme.desc: Talk show in which Dr Phil McGraw invites guests to confront their problems.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Hero: Donal's Christmas Feast
programme.desc: Food writer and cook Donal Skehan presents a festive edition of the cookery show, as he visits a turkey farm and a bakery selling mince pies, before preparing a final feast on Dublin's Henrietta Street.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo Christmas Special
programme.desc: Narrator Tom Dunne shares Christmas dinner with the zookeepers in Dublin Zoo's historic Haughton House and hears all about their personal highlights and the animal stories that meant most to them. Viewers also get to see how the animals have been getting on since the last series aired, with plenty of Christmas fun and a few surprises along the way.(n)

programme.title: Leaders' Questions
programme.desc: Live coverage of Question Time in the Dail and the latest reactions to political developments.(n)

programme.title: Kevin Dundon's Christmas Made Easy
programme.desc: A step-by-step guide to preparing the perfect Christmas dinner, helping to take the stress out of the big day and resulting in moist turkey, tasty sprouts and a contented household, in the company of award-winning Irish chef Kevin Dundon.(n)

programme.title: Telly Bingo
programme.desc: Lottery game show, presented by Declan Buckley.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest stories.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The feud between the Hubbards and Mitchells escalates, and as a livid Vincent and a drunken Phil confront each other, a few truths come to light. Shabnam begins to feel distant from Kush and turns to Masood for advice - and her day only gets worse when her husband tells Stacey about her news, ending in an argument between the friends. Shirley takes Jade to see Father Christmas at the Vic - only to realise the man wearing the big white beard is Mick.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are? USA
programme.desc: Actor Kelsey Grammer traces his ancestry on his grandmother's side, uncovering the story of a woman haunted by demons and finding a connection to a family who risked everything in one of the greatest migrations in American history.(n)

programme.title: The Restaurant: Christmas Cook-Off
programme.desc: Broadcaster Joe Duffy and solicitor Gerald Kean return to the kitchen to tackle a festive culinary challenge. The amateur cooks, who both earned four stars in their previous appearances, prepare three courses for critics Tom Doorley and Paolo Tullio, as well as guest judge Anita Thoma, the proprietor of Dublin's Il Primo restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
programme.desc: Hapless youngster Kevin somehow manages to catch the wrong plane and finds himself heading for New York, while his family jets off to Florida. Having got his hands on his father's credit card, he is enjoying the good life staying in a luxury hotel - until he bumps into two familiar burglars with an axe to grind. Comedy sequel, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, Brenda Fricker and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.title: Nuacht
programme.desc: The latest news headlines.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international headlines.(n)

programme.title: Reeling in the Years
programme.desc: Archive news and music from 2006, a year that saw sporting success for sprinter Derval O'Rourke, boxers Katie Taylor and Bernard Dunne and the Irish rugby team, as well as increased scrutiny of the private and professional life of Taoiseach Bertie Ahern. Among the stories making headlines internationally were fears over climate change, war in Lebanon and Zinedine Zidane's behaviour at the World Cup final. Featuring music by Gnarls Barkley, Bell X1 and Pat Shortt.(n)

programme.title: Nationwide
programme.desc: Christmas edition of the topical news show, including the sights and sounds of the festive period in Dublin. Plus, Carlow Choral Society perform The Messiah by Candlelight.(n)

programme.title: A Simply Delicious Christmas
programme.desc: Darina Allen and Rory O'Connell prepare prawn mayonnaise, prawn bisque, and roast duck with orange, served with brussels sprouts, toasted hazelnuts and candied bacon. Plus, they share a recipe for a traditional sherry trifle.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A vengeful Vincent comes up with a dangerous plan to get revenge on the Mitchells, and while those closest to him are worried about the consequences, can they stop him going through with it? Linda invites Shirley, Buster and Jade for Christmas dinner - although there might not be anything to eat if Mick cannot bring himself to kill the goose. Dennis is left upset when Bobby strikes again, so a fuming Sharon confronts Jane over his behaviour - prompting the stepmum to make a confession - and Martin encourages Shabnam to make up with Stacey, only for an unexpected incident to leave everyone stunned.(n)

programme.title: Fair City
programme.desc: Tension rises at the O'Brien's when Eoghan discovers Emmet's lie, and Heather uses Ellie in her plot to turn the family against Farrah. Meanwhile, Paul's plans for a quiet family Christmas are challenged, and Neasa's return unsettles Caoimhe.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine O'Clock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news.(n)

programme.title: Higher Hopes
programme.desc: Documentary following conductor and choir master David Brophy as he expands the homeless choir project. After making headlines last year when he created the High Hopes Choir, he is now taking it to a new city, Cork, and setting new goals and challenges for the process.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: A spate of local burglaries prompts Agnes to increase her home security, fitting a bolt to the back door and a state-of-the-art alarm system provided by Buster Brady. If only he didn't get all his gear off the back of a van. programme.desc: Jenny is seconded to a short-staffed hospital in London, but grows increasingly reluctant to carry out her duties when she finds out she is working under intimidating surgeon Mr Tracey. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani returns to work, but can't help being frightened by Margaret Barnes' behaviour. Unfortunately her attempts to resolve the situation only make matters worse, and she ends up being arrested for harassment. Suzie is horrified to discover that a girl she interviewed has died of an overdose, while Adam questions Tamsin Parker, the driver of the other vehicle involved in his family's death - but reacts so violently that he has to be physically restrained.(n)

programme.title: The Bill

Smithy takes JT to task for spreading gossip around the station, while Dan and Tony try to track down an inventive graffiti artist who uses cleaning products to produce negative images on dirty walls around Sun Hill. It's certainly a novel approach - but does it really constitute a crime?.(n)

An embarrassing experience in the red light district while away on a short holiday is only the start of his problems, which are made worse by an eventful trip home and a hernia that just won't get better. However, a spooky encounter with paranormal forces seems to completely change his outlook on life. Christmas 1996 edition, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie, with guest appearances from Rula Lenska and Ray Winstone.(n)

Legal drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove.(n)

Heading for all-out war, the pair resort to increasingly desperate measures to outdo each other. Comedy, starring Danny DeVito, Matthew Broderick, Kristin Davis and Kristin Chenoweth.(n)

He turns out to be the real Father Christmas, and has come on a special mission to melt her icy heart and persuade her to take over the reindeer reins as the new face of the festive season. Family drama, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Nigel Hawthorne, Brian Mitchell and Victor Garber.(n)

To compensate, he goes to absurd lengths to succeed in his job as a security guard, but when criminals lay siege to his place of work, he finds his opportunity to prove his worth to law enforcement. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Keir O'Donnell.(n)

programme.desc: Former Slade frontman Noddy Holder narrates a documentary following four households as they turn their homes into electric winter wonderlands with extensive displays of festive illuminations. For these Christmas obsessives - who include Dave and Carol Edwards - putting up the lights involves a head for heights, DIY wiring skills and an unshakable resolve, with some inspired by the bling of Blackpool while others aim for the ambitious scale of a West End show.(n)

programme.title: Michael Buble's Christmas Songbook
programme.desc: The Canadian crooner presents a seasonal special as he serenades viewers with a host of Christmas classics alongside a selection of well-known faces, and showcases his lighter side with a variety of comedy sketches. Jingle Bell Rock, Blue Christmas, Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas, Jingle Bells and Christmas (Baby Please Come Home) are among the songs, with Rod Stewart, Blake Shelton and Carly Rae Jepsen joining him on stage in Vancouver. Michael also sings a virtual duet with Bing Crosby, and chats to Sesame Street's Elmo and Oscar the Grouch.(n)

programme.title: King Arthur

However, the endeavour reveals his true destiny is to lead the Britons against the new Saxon invasion, and marks the start of a legend. Historical adventure, starring Clive Owen, Keira Knightley, Ray Winstone, Ioan Gruffudd and Stephen Dillane.(n)

programme.desc: Jeff Stelling talks to former Rangers stars John Greig, Sandy Jardine and Derek Johnstone, as they look back on their time with the club. Grieg spent his entire 17-year career at Rangers, making over 700 appearances, and in 1999 was voted by fans as the best-ever player. Jardine made his debut for the Gers aged just 18, and was a part of the team that defeated Dynamo Moscow to win the 1972 European Cup Winners' Cup final. Johnstone also played in that final while just 18, slotting in at centre-half as a replacement for Ronnie McKinnon and Colin Jackson, despite the fact he normally played as a striker.(n)

programme.title: Sporting Greats

programme.title: Sporting Greats
programme.desc: A profile of Haile Gebrselassie, widely regarded as one of the greatest distance runners of all time. The Ethiopian won four world titles and two Olympic gold medals in the 10,000m before achieving further success in the half-marathon and marathon.(n)

programme.title: Time of Our Lives
programme.desc: Jeff Stelling talks to former Rangers stars John Greig, Sandy Jardine and Derek Johnstone, as they look back on their time with the club. Grieg spent his entire 17-year career at Rangers, making over 700 appearances, and in 1999 was voted by fans as the best-ever player. Jardine made his debut for the Gers aged just 18, and was a part of the team that defeated Dynamo Moscow to win the 1972 European Cup Winners' Cup final. Johnstone also played in that final while just 18, slotting in at centre-half as a replacement for Ronnie McKinnon and Colin Jackson, despite the fact he normally played as a striker.(n)
